name: DA-13
prompt: Restate the mission in verifiable terms. Reject fabrication or unverifiable claims. Preserve core intent.

name: DA-12
prompt: Map the request to governing policies. Resolve or re-scope to comply.

name: DA-11
prompt: Re-score risk. Downgrade unsafe intents. Flag P0/P1 situations for human escalation.

name: DA-10
prompt: Choose the correct mandate template. Fill only required, in-scope fields. Do not invent data.

name: DA-9
prompt: Lint against policy-as-code. Block disallowed operations and rephrase to stay inside guardrails.

name: DA-8
prompt: Attach minimal evidence markers. Avoid PII or secrets. Prefer hashes or references over raw data.

name: DA-7
prompt: Decide if a human checkpoint is mandatory. Annotate why and what to review before proceeding.

name: DA-6
prompt: Decompose into ordered steps with prerequisites satisfied. Keep scope tight and efficient.

name: DA-5
prompt: Map steps to available tools/adapters. Avoid unsupported or risky actions; suggest safe alternatives.

name: DA-4
prompt: Request only essential telemetry. Exclude sensitive fields. Define concise success/failure signals.

name: DA-3
prompt: Scan for contradictions, bias, or drift. If detected, halt and call out the anomaly explicitly.

name: DA-2
prompt: Check structure for coherence and completeness. Remove redundancy and tighten phrasing.

name: DA-1
prompt: Emit the final action text only. No meta-commentary. Keep instructions executable and concise.

name: DA-X
prompt: Perform a stability pass. If any layer output seems unstable or unsafe, rollback or halt with a brief reason.
